title: Metro father wanted after young boy accidentally shoots himself
content:
MIDWEST CITY, Okla. (KOKH) —
Police are on the hunt for a metro father they say brought a loaded gun into a home prior to a young boy accidentally shooting himself.
The Del City Police Department reports that around 12 a.m. Nov. 2 a 4-year-old boy accidentally shot himself at a residence in the 2300 block of Mansfield Avenue.
Police say the boy's father, 25-year-old Henry Hoffman, was at the home and got in an argument with the boy's mother, 30-year-old Tracy Bocquin. At some point, Hoffman brought a loaded gun inside the home.
Hoffman then left the residence. The boy was transported to a local hospital in serious condition. Police say methamphetamine and marijuana were found inside the home.
Bocquin and a second person inside the home, 31-year-old Ryan Kidder, were both arrested on scene. Police are still on the hunt for Hoffman.
An arrest warrant is active for Hoffman on complaints of child neglect, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of marijuana.
Bocquin faces complaints of child neglect, maintaining a a place where controlled dangerous substance is kept, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of marijuana.
Kidder faces two complaints of possession of a CDS within 1,000 feet of a school/park/church and two complaints of possession of drug paraphernalia.
